title: Album Cover, "Talking Heads: Blind", 1988
creditline: Gift of Tibor Kalman/ M & co.
description:
Recto: The entire space is occupied by a reproduction of an Italian Baroque illusionist architectural painting, Allegory of the Missionary Work of the Jesuits (The Apotheosis of San Ignazio) by Andrea Pozzo. Talking Heads / Blind is imprinted in small white capitals in the upper left hand corner. The song lyrics are imprinted in blue capitals on seventeen lines, top to bottom, stretching from left edge to right.
Verso: There is a navy blue strip about five inches wide, beginning at the left edge and stretching from top to bottom. Song lyrics are imprinted in upper and lower case letters on thirty-two lines occupying the entire strip, except for narrow margins. The remaining background space to the right of the strip is yellow. Information about the album songs and personnel is imprinted in black on brief horizontal lines, laid out so as to form a vertical curve from top to bottom. The songs, listed according to the two album sides, are centered top to bottom to the right of the curve.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Cover, "Talking Heads: Blind", 1988.
1988. Offset lithography. Gift of Tibor Kalman/ M & co.. 1993-151-79.
